newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Turkmen-Iran gas pipeline construction underway.
newsitem.headline: Turkmen-Iran gas pipeline construction underway.

text.p: Construction of a gas pipeline linking the Central Asian state of Turkmenistan and neighbouring Iran has begun, a Turkmen government official said Friday.
"Work began on Thursday on the pipeline and Iranian Oil Minister Gholamreza Aghazadeh was present," said a spokesman for the Turkmen Foreign Ministry in the Turkmen capital Ashgabat.
Turkmenistan aims to deliver 280 billion cubic feet a year of natural gas to Iran by 2000.
The pipeline, 120 miles in length, will run from the Korpedzhe gas field in western Turkmenistan to Kurt-Kui in northern Iran.
Work on the $190 million project, 80 percent financed by Tehran, is scheduled for completion at the end of 1997.
Turkmen President Saparmurat Niyazov has said that the Turkmen-Iranian pipeline is the first link in a project to bring Turkmen gas to markets in Turkey and Europe.
